channel.title: Server Help?
channel.description:
Hi everybody I'm the owner of froobyscape and I'm planning on releasing my server again but i forgot how to run it and sadly I can't compile anymore.
I have a couple problems well I'm not so sure on how to get a server running on windows vista... but ya I have JDK 6 update 7 but i dont know what to put in classpath and path Another problem is that I downloaded my JDK 6 update 7 but I don't know what to do after its done downloading in the sun download manager please help me fast o.O?

item.title: Server Help?
item.dc:creator: @slaya101 slaya101
item.description:
@slaya101 wrote:

[quote=“Not Pwnd, post:2, topic:224524”]You can’t compile?.. Ok…

Right click Computer on your start menu. Go to properties. Go to advanced system settings on the left. On the bottom right click environmental variables. There is two boxes on that screen. Under the TOP box, you should see the button ‘new’.
Click it. For the Variable name, you have to put exactly:

Path

for the Variable value, you have to put exactly:
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin

save it, test it by opening up command prompt and typing javac.[/quote]

still doenst work says javac is not recognized blah blah blah and also did i do the jdk thingy right or is there more to go after the sun download manager?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 08, 2008, 10:15:15 pm[/size][hr]someone please help me quick :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 08, 2008, 10:31:14 pm[/size][hr]uhh help some help quick???

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help?
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

You can’t compile?.. Ok…

Right click Computer on your start menu. Go to properties. Go to advanced system settings on the left. On the bottom right click environmental variables. There is two boxes on that screen. Under the TOP box, you should see the button ‘new’.
Click it. For the Variable name, you have to put exactly:

Path

for the Variable value, you have to put exactly:
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin

save it, test it by opening up command prompt and typing javac.

Read full topic
